Chapter 2 Week 1 In the first week we had a talk about the course syllabus and discussed about Machine Learning examples. For the second week we will do a refresher on Python. Please bring your laptops and install Anaconda with Python 3.7. 2.1 Install Anaconda Install Anaconda https://www.anaconda.com/distribution/#download-section Click on start menu and choose anaconda prompt’(windows) OR run terminal (osx/ubuntu) Create a virtual environment (e.g. ‘mbl-ml’, could be any name you like): • > conda create -n mbl-ml python=3.7 ipykernel Activate the virtual environment: • > source activate mbl-ml Install dependencies: • Change directory to where the given file (requirements.txt) resides. • > cd (just drag your folder into the cmd/terminal) • > pip install -r requirements.txt Make kernel accessible in jupyter notebook: • > python -m ipykernel install –user –name mbl-ml Go to the directory that you would like to save your notebooks • > cd (just drag your folder into the cmd/terminal) Run jupyter notebook: • > jupyter notebook Create new file and set kernel to ‘mbl-ml’ To shut down jupyter: • Press cmd ‘C’ or > ctrl ‘C’ at the terminal/cmd prompt To deactivate virtual environment: • > conda deactivate
